topic.title: Adding Predefined Product Groups to Programs

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Adding Predefined Product Groups to Programs

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Describes adding predefined product groups to programs, including conditions, exclusions, and SKU-level membership rules that apply during activation and program configuration.

othermeta.name: entities
othermeta.content: predefined-product-group; product-group; sku; program; exclusion-rule; activation

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: procedural guidance for assigning and validating predefined product groups within incentive programs

body.p: Customer Incentive Manager enables you to add predefined product groups that are not part of the product master to the programs and you have the flexibility of offering a different type of programs to a dynamic combination of products, product categories. You can add such product groups to a program by using typeahead or add products when defining a benefit line.
Perform the following steps for adding predefined product groups to programs:

ol.li: Navigate to Qualifications and Benefits page

Click Search as shown in the following image.
Product Catalog page appears as follows.

Click Search Filters to search and view predefined product groups.
You can view basic search with the following fields:
Name
Code
ID

Click Go to Advanced for advanced search.
You can view advanced search with the following fields:
Field
Operator
Value

body.p: Conditions for adding the predefined groups:

ul.li: You can view only the activated product groups in a tree view. The checkbox for products and categories is either hidden or grayed out for each member.
You cannot update the structure and content of the predefined product groups.

You can only select the product group, not a member of the product group and the checkbox of each member including subcategories are disabled or hidden. Once selected, the product group appears in the Selected tab.
You can remove the product group in the Selected tab. Once removed, the checkbox is unchecked in the "Product Groups" list view.
You cannot define exclusions at the benefit line level for product groups.
You can expand the categories included in the product groups.
You can view the excluded products in a category with a visual indicator indicates that it is being excluded.
